column5: caribou.caThey have colors you will find no where else. Stupid sharp hooks, very durable paint jobs as well and because the paint is tough the eyes are already opened...they guarantee it. Better known under the name Jig A Jo.I have jigs I bought from them about 6 years ago... and use them alot, they look as new as when I bought them.
Hutches jig. Good prices. Great to deal with
www.jeffscustomjigs.com
check ebay - have gotten mine there before - best deals

4 years ago I stumbled on to a some very good powder painted jigs at www.crawdadsfishing tackle.com. After nocking the paint off jigs for years fishing the bedrock bottom lakes in north eastern Ontario i hooked up on the web with Jason crawfords jigs he personly makes. he will makem any way you want. has a couple different hook selections, all different weights including his latest its 3/16 oz and has a bait holder on the top and bottom of the tail of the lead, it holds our plastic on for meany more catches. the weight being between 1/8 and 1/4 is perfect for a good presentatin in up to about 20 FOW. The eyelets are always open Probably bought 500 to 600 from him in 4 years. i recommend you go to his website then call him and personally and communicate what you want. This fellow has great products with great service Halfmoon
WWW.crawdadsfishingtackle.com

Thanks for all the replies and suggestions. I haven't had a chance to really look into all of them, and place an order yet but I will soon and let you know what I went with. Again, thanks for all the help.
Reeves near Decatur, IL. Www.reeveslureco.com They are know for jigs without paint in the eye.
Reeves near Decatur, IL. Www.reeveslureco.com They are know for jigs without paint in the eye. DK

I fish a reservoir and go through lots of jigs. I buy all my jigs from Cabela's. Packs of 25 jigs sell for $5-6 if you order solid colors. I typically buy florescent orange in 1/8, 1/4, 3/8 oz sizes. In the spring , they have a sale and the price is $4-5 per 25.
http://www.barlowstackle.com
I second www.jeffscustomjigs.com
Wondering where you guys buy jigs? I'm looking for 100-200 1/8 ,1/4 and 3/8 ounce. Anyone know of a site with good prices and possibly free shipping?
http://www.jacksjigs.com/index.php?route=common/home

I like Jacks Jigs. I was using big plastic swimbaits from them 10 years before there was any popularity for them. But for bulk price, I go to ebay. Large selection of plain jig heads that I powder coat (or not) and a great price.
I recently bought two 100 ct. packs of assorted colored Northland jigs at Mills Fleet for $20 a pack. Bought 1/4 and 3/8. Can't say if they are the "best' or not but they work fine for me.
Try this guy www.jigs4u.com/ I am very happy with his product.

Cabelas has a good selection of jigs. I don't like their regular prices, but if you catch things on sale or clearance you can stock up at great prices. I'm lucky to have one close to where I work. I swing by on my lunch hour a few times per month to look for deals.

http://www.capnredbeards.com/http://www.sirmanski.com/masterwalleyejig.aspxTake a look at these sites, both have been great for me in Ontario. Sirmanski is owned my a WC regular, Mike Kansas, great guy and he loves to fish Ontario! Happy shopping!

I'm with Mr Simon. Watch for the sales, watch for free shipping. If you sign up for the emails, you get offers and can always delete or unsubscribe when you're done. I did a BIG stock-up a couple years ago using both sale prices (think January) and free shipping from an email.
Have been using jigs from www.baitrigs.com there based out of verona, wi.qaulity made jigs with great hooks .they have a wide variety of muskie lurescto.
Hutch's jigs Can order at www.riverwalleyes.com We have been extremely happy with what we have received and we think it is a very fair price.
